channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: From 400-year-old globes to cosmic shrouds: A Maine library brings maps to life
item.description: From 400-year-old globes to cosmic funeral shrouds, how the Osher Map Library in Maine shows people that maps aren't just for navigation — but windows into history, culture, and how we see the world.
item.content:encoded:
From 400-year-old globes to cosmic funeral shrouds, how the Osher Map Library in Maine shows people that maps aren't just for navigation — but windows into history, culture, and how we see the world.

(Image credit: Greta Rybus)
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Benin's interior minister says a coup announced earlier has been foiled
item.description: Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin 's state TV Sunday to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier, a group of soldiers had appeared on Benin 's state TV Sunday to announce the dissolution of the government in an apparent coup, the latest of many in West Africa.

(Image credit: Eraldo Peres)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state kills at least 25, officials say
item.description: At least 25 people, including tourists, were killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state, the state's chief minister said Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
At least 25 people, including tourists, were killed in a fire at a popular nightclub in India's Goa state, the state's chief minister said Sunday.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At least 18 migrants die after boat sinks near Greek island of Crete
item.description: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities said Saturday. At least two people have been rescued.
item.content:encoded: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities said Saturday. At least two people have been rescued.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Putin finds a warm welcome in India
item.description: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despite U.S. pressure.
item.content:encoded: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despite U.S. pressure.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: National parks fee-free calendar drops MLK Day, Juneteenth and adds Trump's birthday
item.description: The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-exempt days for visitors at dozens of national parks.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-exempt days for visitors at dozens of national parks.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Waymo will recall software after its self-driving cars passed stopped school buses
item.description: Waymo is issuing a software recall for its self-driving cars after reports the company's autonomous vehicles failed to stop for school buses.
item.content:encoded:
Waymo is issuing a software recall for its self-driving cars after reports the company's autonomous vehicles failed to stop for school buses.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Jeff Brady

item.title: 7 deaths and hundreds of injuries are linked to faulty Abbott glucose monitors
item.description: About 3 million glucose monitoring sensors were potentially affected by a production error that caused incorrect low glucose readings.
item.content:encoded:
About 3 million glucose monitoring sensors were potentially affected by a production error that caused incorrect low glucose readings.

(Image credit: Jill Delsaux)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Sudanese paramilitary drone attack kills 50, including 33 children, doctor group says
item.description: Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese military, who have been at war for over two years.
item.content:encoded:
Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese military, who have been at war for over two years.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Russia unleashes drone and missile attack on Ukraine as diplomatic talks continue
item.description: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.
item.content:encoded:
Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
